author: Special Correspondent
text:
A proper assessment of the cardiac health status of the CPI(M) leader from Kannur, P. Jayarajan, could take a few days as a series of medical evaluations were being done, a medical bulletin issued by the Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology (SCTIMST) said here on Thursday.

Mr. Jayarajan, who had been referred to SCTIMST from the Government Medical College, Kozhikode, for detailed cardiac evaluation, had been brought to the institute late Wednesday night.

The medical bulletin said that he had chest discomfort on transfer Wednesday and that he is currently admitted to the ICU. He has been known to have had heart problems since the past one decade and has undergone multiple angioplasties, the last one being done in July last year. His condition currently remains stable with no symptoms and with no serial ECG or blood test changes, the bulletin said.
title: Jayarajan’s cardiac evaluation will take time
